meanings.sent1: The sun will expose the hidden treasure in the sand.
meanings.sent2: The detective will expose the criminal's hiding spot.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick was to expose the rabbit in the hat.
meanings.sent4: The storm will expose the fragile nature of the old house.
meanings.sent5: The flashlight's beam will expose the dark corners of the room.

meanings.definition: Reveal the true nature of (someone or something).
meanings.sent1: The documentary will expose the harsh reality of life in the jungle.
meanings.sent2: The investigation will expose the dishonesty of the politician.
meanings.sent3: The comedy show will expose the silliness of the popular trends.
meanings.sent4: The mirror will expose the reflection of your true self.
meanings.sent5: The test will expose the student's knowledge of the subject.

meanings.definition: Subject (someone or something) to an action or influence.
meanings.sent1: The doctor will expose the patient to the new treatment.
meanings.sent2: The experiment will expose the plants to different light conditions.
meanings.sent3: The prank will expose the friend to a surprise scare.
meanings.sent4: The training will expose the team to intense physical challenges.
meanings.sent5: The journey will expose the travelers to diverse cultures.
